English: I feel shy.
You feel ashamed.
She feels angry.
We feel confused.
You (plural) feel depressed.
They feel afraid.
You feel tired.
I feel like yawning.
You feel like you have to pee.
He feels weak.
We feel like we have to cough.
They feel nauseous.

you feel ashamed

I don't feel shy
you don't feel ashamed

we don't feel confused
you don't feel depressed
they don't feel afraid
They're amazed by the large milk consumption.
Sometimes his wife's behavior confuses him.

Finnish: Meitä mietityttää, kenelle video on tarkoitettu.
English: We're wondering who the video is meant for.
hungarian: Kíváncsiak vagyunk, kinek szól a videó.

English: I'm confused about the doctor's diagnosis.
We're worried about climate change.
I started to feel pity for the boy.

Finnish: Minua nolotti, kun en tunnistanut häntä.
English: I was embarrassed when I didn't recognise her.
hungarian: Zavarban voltam, hogy nem ismertem fel.

English: I feel so ashamed…
The girl got a bit shy.
We regret coming to Finland.
They feel like crying because of the sad movie.

Finnish: Minua surettaa, että hän ei ymmärrä minua.
English: It saddens me that he doesn't understand me.
The grey autumn makes many feel depressed.

Finnish: Minua harmittaa, kun unohdan avaimet kotiin.
English: I feel annoyed, when I forget my keys at home.
hungarian: Felháborít, ha otthon felejtem a kulcsokat.

Finnish: Meitä ärsyttää, koska bussi on myöhässä.
English: We feel annoyed, because the bus is late.

Finnish: Minua inhottaa sade ja kova tuuli.
English: I detest rain and hard wind.
hungarian: Utálom az esőt és az erős szelet.

Finnish: Vauvaa kiukuttaa, jos hän ei saa ruokaa.
English: The baby feels annoyed if he doesn't get food.
hungarian: A baba mérges lesz, ha nem kap enni.

Finnish: Teitä suututtaa, koska se on loppuunmyyty.
English: You feel angry, because it's sold out.
This constant rain pisses me off.

Finnish: Minua raivostuttaa, koska et ymmärrä minua.
English: I feel angry, because you don't understand me.

Finnish: Häntä pelottaa, koska huoneessa on pimeää.
English: She's scared because it's dark in the room.
The traffic on the road horrified us.
The brutality of the crime horrified everyone.
I was terrified, but I agreed to do it regardless.
The question shook him.
I feel anxiety about using the building's sauna.
hungarian: Aggódok, hogy elmegyek a lakóközösségi szaunába.

English: Dad feels worried about the heavy traffic.
hungarian: Apa ideges a forgalmas forgalom miatt.

English: I started to get fed up with myself.
She is pleased with the frankness of Finns.
The question makes mom and dad smile.
hungarian: A kérdés megmosolyogtatja anyát és apát.

Finnish: Minua naurattaa, kun katson hauskaa elokuvaa.
English: I feel like laughing when I watch a funny movie.
hungarian: Megnevettet, ha egy vicces filmet nézek.

Finnish: Minua ilahduttaa, kun sinä tuot kukkia.
English: I feel delighted when you bring flowers.
I feel amused by reality tv shows.
He doesn't feel like leaving.
In winter, we warm up with hot chocolate milk.
hungarian: Télen a forró kakaó melegít bennünket.

Finnish: Ulkona on liian kylmää. Meitä paleltaa.
English: Outside it's too cold. We feel cold.

Finnish: Kaupungilla oli kuumaa. Nyt minua janottaa.
English: It was hot in the city. Now I feel thirsty.
hungarian: Meleg volt a városban. Most szomjas vagyok.

English: It's already late: I feel sleepy.

Finnish: Kun olen väsynyt, minua piristää kahvia.
English: When I'm tired, I get woken up by some coffee.
hungarian: Ha fáradt vagyok, a kávé felvidít.

English: I always feel tired in the morning.

Finnish: Potilasta huimaa, kun hän yrittää nousta.
English: The patient feels dizzy when she tries to get up.
hungarian: A beteg szédül, amikor megpróbál felkelni.

English: I feel like I have to pee all the time.

Finnish: Kun lasta kakattaa, hän kertoo sen.
English: When the child feels he has to poo, he says so.
hungarian: Ha egy gyerek kakil, elmondja neked.

English: The sweater makes the skin itch.
You feel like yawning. Go ahead and sleep.
I feel like I have to sneeze all the time.
I always have to cough after sports.
The driver felt faint right before the car crash.
hungarian: A sofőr elgyengült közvetlenül a baleset előtt.

English: These women are nauseated by a hairy man.
hungarian: Ezeket a nőket egy szőrös férfi forgatja fel.

Finnish: Monet sairaudet voivat hikoiluttaa sinua yöllä.
English: Many illnesses can make you sweat at night.

Finnish: Mene lääkäriin, jos päätä jomottaa koko ajan.
English: Go to a doctor, if your head aches all the time.
hungarian: Forduljon orvoshoz, ha úgy dönt, hogy állandóan elrontja.

English: My neck feels hot.

Finnish: Minua oksettaa, mutta en ole vielä oksentanut.
English: I feel like throwing up, but I haven't yet.
hungarian: Van kedvem hányni, de még nem hánytam.

English: Spiders make me shiver.
Climbing the stairs makes you breathless.
hungarian: Ha felmegy a lépcsőn, eláll a lélegzete.
